p:
Homology modeling of the putative HaFatA and HaFatB protein structures was performed with Deepview and the Swiss Model Workspace software ( Guex and Peitsch, 1997
2 ), using their protein sequences and an available 12:0-ACP thioesterase crystal structure from Umbellularia californica as a template (Protein Data Bank Accession 5X04; Feng et al., 2017). HaFatA (89–361) and HaFatB (129–414) peptides were modeled against this template, with sequence identities of 44.6 and 58.1%, respectively. Molecular docking experiments were performed with SwissDock, using palmitic, stearic and oleic acids as substrates ( Grosdidier et al., 2011a, b), and I-TASSER
3 ( Yang et al., 2015). Critical residue mapping and visualizations were performed using the UCSF Chimera package ( Pettersen et al., 2004).
